thread.title: The moment female hit-squad assassinates Korean dictator s brother with poison spray - Yahoo7
thread.title_full: The moment female hit-squad assassinates Korean dictator s brother with poison spray - Yahoo7

author: Agencies On February
title: The moment female hit-squad assassinates Korean dictator s brother with poison spray - Yahoo7
text:
Share The moment female hit-squad assassinates Korean dictator s brother with poison spray - Yahoo7 A female hit squad member’s well-orchestrated assassination of North Korea's Kim Jong-un’s half-brother has been captured on CCTV. Close WARNING GRAPHIC IMAGES: CCTV captures hit squad's alleged assasination of Kim Jong Un's half brother. UP NEXT VIDEO CCTV captures hit squad's alleged assasination of Kim Jong Un's half brother. Source: YouTube/Malaysian News WARNING GRAPHIC IMAGES: CCTV captures hit squad's alleged assasination of Kim Jong Un's half brother. 
Kim Jong-nam, who publicly spoke out against the North Korean leader’s regime, was found dead at the Kuala Lumpur International Airport after he was allegedly sprayed in the face with a deadly poison. 
Leaked footage from the Malaysian airport shows the moment one woman grabbed Jong-nam from behind while another allegedly sprayed a fast-acting poison in his face before both women casually fled the scene. 
Further CCTV showed the 46 year old Jong-nam approaching authorities and explaining what had happened. Moments later he was allegedly found dead on an airport chair. It's alleged that one woman held Kim Jong-nam from behind while another sprayed or smother him with a fast-acting toxic substance. Source: BH TV The 46 year old could then be seen alerting authorities. Source: BH TV 
Meanwhile, Malaysian police have arrested a North Korean chemistry expert in connection with his murder and are hunting a further four men who flew out of Kuala Lumpur on the same day. 
Ri Jong-chol, 47, who studied medicine and chemistry in Pyongyang was arrested following Jong-nam’s death. Suspects fled Malaysia after Jong-nam murder 
“The suspects wore grey, purple and green clothing respectively prior to the attack,” a police spokesperson told reporters. 
“However, after the attack, they went to a restroom and changed before heading to the departure hall to board their flight. The chemistry expert was arrested following an intense manhunt. Source: Reuters Kim Jong-nam publicly opposed his half-brother's regime. Source: AAP 
The latest arrest comes after a North Korean man, a Vietnamese woman and an Indonesian woman were all arrested in connection with the assassination. 
South Korean and US officials believe Kim Jong-nam was killed by agents from the reclusive North, whose diplomats in KL sought to prevent an autopsy on the 46-year-old's body and demanded it be handed over. 
"We believe the North Korean regime is behind this incident considering five suspects are North Koreans" Jeong Joon-hee, spokesman at South Korea's Unification Ministry, told a briefing on Sunday. 
"Next plan is to get them. We of course have international co-operation especially with Interpol, bilateral involvement with the country involved, we will go through those avenues to get the people involved." Doan Thi Huong from Vietnam has been arrested in connection with the murder. Source: AFP Siti Aisyah from Indonesia has also been arrested in connection with the murder. Source: AFP 
He named the four who escaped as Ri Ji Hyon, Hong Song Hac, O Joong Gil, and Ri Jae Nam. 
Police said the cause of death was still not known and they were waiting for pathology and toxicology tests after conducting a post-mortem. Close Kim Jong-Un's half brother assassinated UP NEXT
